subject: Re: [junit] Can't run anything from textui?
msgSnippet: ... Yes, I get the same result when I create this class as com.example.namespace.TestTest. ... OK, textui-runner-issue.zip is now in the files section. Here s
messageBody:
On Mar 21, 2005, at 2:20 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Now you might mean "I've tried the same thing when TestTest is not in
> the default package, such as com.mycom.TestTest". If that's the case,
> then ignore the foregoing.

Yes, I get the same result when I create this class as
com.example.namespace.TestTest.

>> I've worked around the issue by creating an AllTests class with a main
>> method, but I would very much like to know what I'm doing wrong, or if
>> textui isn't supposed to work this way, or if there's a bug (which I
>> doubt).
>
> The text-based UI certainly does work that way, but the above won't
> work
> because TestTest is in the default package. If you can put your source
> in a .zip and throw it in the files section, we can look more closely
> at it.

OK, textui-runner-issue.zip is now in the files section. Here's what I
ran right before creating the archive:

~/src/junit-try $ rm *.class
~/src/junit-try $ javac com/example/namespace/TestTest.java
~/src/junit-try $ java junit.textui.TestRunner
com.example.namespace.TestTest
Class not found "com.example.namespace.TestTest"
~/src/junit-try $ java junit.swingui.TestRunner
com.example.namespace.TestTest

(Swing UI popped up and failed correctly with the expected failure)

~/src/junit-try $ java -cp . junit.textui.TestRunner
com.example.namespace.TestTest
Class not found "com.example.namespace.TestTest"

--
Ryan Platte
Site 9


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
